meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Melissa Spencer Kim Vu Steve Stoffle Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7261.

td.p: Melissa Spencer, an adjunct physics instructor and stay-at-home mom from Des Moines, Iowa
Kim Vu, an international development project manager from Washington, D.C.
Steve Stoffle, a leadership trainer from Decatur, Georgia (whose 1-day cash winnings total $17,599)

tr.td: NOW YOU SEE ME
WORLD HOLIDAYS
E BEFORE I
AROUND THE USA
THE FRENCH MISTAKE, VOILA!
WE LOVE MEL BROOKS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'In Thailand, the month of May brings his "enlightenment"; his "cremation" comes later')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In Thailand, the month of May brings his "enlightenment"; his "cremation" comes later

tr.td: Steve
Kim
Melissa
POP QUIZ
AMERICAN POETS
20th CENTURY
NEWSPAPERS
ART FOR ART'S SAKE
WORDS THAT START LIKE THE DAY OF THE WEEK
(Alex: For instance, if the clue said, "The sixth planet from the Sun", "What is Saturn?" That starts with "S-A-T-" for "Saturday".)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_3_2', 'clue_DJ_3_2_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from the USS Wisconsin in Norfolk, Virginia.) As war gave way to peace & then to war again, the battleship Wisconsin was mothballed three times & recommissioned twice; her latest return to service was in 1988, & three years later, she became the last U.S. battleship to actively participate in a foreign war when she took part in this operation')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from the USS Wisconsin in Norfolk, Virginia.) As war gave way to peace & then to war again, the battleship Wisconsin was mothballed three times & recommissioned twice; her latest return to service was in 1988, & three years later, she became the last U.S. battleship to actively participate in a foreign war when she took part in this operation
